noun.description: A period of keeping awake during the time usually spent asleep, especially to keep watch or pray.
examples: my birdwatching vigils lasted for hours
as he lay in a coma the family kept vigil

noun.description: (in the Christian Church) the eve of a festival or holy day as an occasion of religious observance.

origin: Middle English (in vigil (sense 2)): via Old French from Latin vigilia, from vigil awake.
